message.content:
Reinforcement Learning, Neural Networks

The paper belongs to the sub-category of Reinforcement Learning as it presents a learning algorithm based on incremental dynamic programming to solve multiple Markovian decision tasks (MDTs). The agent learns to solve a set of composite and elemental MDTs by producing a temporal decomposition. The paper also belongs to the sub-category of Neural Networks as it presents a modular network architecture that allows a single learning agent to learn to solve multiple MDTs with significant transfer of learning across the tasks. The architecture is trained on a set of composite and elemental MDTs.
